moves.1. d4: This is the third match between us
moves.1... d5: The first two ended in draws
moves.3. a3 a5: This one started out a little different
moves.4. bxa5 Rxa5 5. e3 c5 6. Bd2 Ra7 7. dxc5: 21 moves and finally a 1 point lead
moves.23... Nf3+: instead of saving the rook I try for getting the white king out in the open
moves.24. Bxf3 exf3 25. Bxa5 fxg2: 2 points down now but I have the king in a bad spot
moves.26. Re1 Bxh3 27. f4 Qd6: threatening the f4 pawn if the queen takes it the pawn on e3 is pinned
moves.29... Bf5 30. Qxg2 h6: starting to think a pawn storm is my best chance now
moves.31. Nd2 Qxf4 32. Qf3: I don't want to trade queens
moves.32... Qg5+ 33. Kf2 Qh4+ 34. Qg3: But I have no better choice
moves.49... h2 50. Rd2: Don't want to give up the pawn
moves.50... Qxf3+: So this looked like the best move
moves.54. Kf2 Qxg5 55. Rd1: I wanted to move the bishop here but had to avoid 56. Rg1... pinning my queen
moves.55... Qh4+ 56. Kg1 Qg4+:
But now I have the rook too.
White resigned at this point. 
The pawns won the day in this game.
